crypto

Class DES

  • java.lang.Object
    • crypto.DES

  • public class DES
extends Object
    This class implements DES in ECB and CBC modes using PKCS5 padding.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DES.OperationMode
      DES operation mode.

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(byte[] clearText)
        Encrypt provided bytes using key generated during class instantiation.

        clearText - bytes to be encrypted
        Returns:
        encrypted bytes

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(byte[] cipherText)
        Decrypt provided bytes using key generated during class instantiation.
        Parameters:
        cipherText - encrypted bytes
        Returns:
        decrypted bytes

      • encryptBlock

        public void encryptBlock(byte[] clearText,
                         int clearOff,
                         byte[] cipherText,
                         int cipherOff,
                         DES.OperationMode opMode)
        Encrypt a block of eight bytes.
        Parameters:
        clearText - clear bytes
        clearOff - offset to clear bytes being encrypted
        cipherText - encrypted bytes
        cipherOff - offset to encrypted bytes being produced
        opMode - operation mode of encrypt

      • decryptBlock

        public void decryptBlock(byte[] cipherText,
                         int cipherOff,
                         byte[] clearText,
                         int clearOff,
                         DES.OperationMode opMode)
        Decrypt a block of eight bytes.
        Parameters:
        cipherText - encrypted bytes
        cipherOff - offset to encrypted bytes being decrypted
        clearText - decrypted bytes
        clearOff - offset to decrypted bytes being produced
        opMode - operation mode of decrypt

      • addPadding

        public byte[] addPadding(byte[] input)
        Add padding to input below block size according to PKCS5.
        Parameters:
        input - for which padding might be required
        Returns:
        input with possible padding

      • removePadding

        public byte[] removePadding(byte[] input)
        Remove padding according to PKCS5 from input if present.
        Parameters:
        input - containing possible padding
        Returns:
        input with padding, if any, removed

        Parameters:

      • deskey

        private void deskey(byte[] keyBlock,
                    boolean encrypting,
                    int[] KnL)
        Create sub-keys used during DES.
        Parameters:
        keyBlock - original key
        encrypting - flag indicating whether keys are for encrypting (true) or decrypting (false)
        KnL - generated sub-keys

      • cookey

        private void cookey(int[] rawKey,
                    int[] cookedKeys)
        Combine generated sub-keys into whole keys.
        Parameters:
        rawKey - raw sub-key
        cookedKeys - cooked sub-key

      • squashBytesToInts

        private void squashBytesToInts(byte[] inBytes,
                               int inOff,
                               int[] outInts,
                               int outOff,
                               int intLen)
        Transform bytes into integers for DES.
        Parameters:
        inBytes - bytes to be processed
        inOff - offset to bytes being processed
        outInts - output of processed bytes
        outOff - offset to output
        intLen - block length being processed

      • spreadIntsToBytes

        private void spreadIntsToBytes(int[] inInts,
                               int inOff,
                               byte[] outBytes,
                               int outOff,
                               int intLen)
        Transform integers into bytes after DES processing.
        Parameters:
        inInts - integers to be processed
        inOff - offset to integers being processed
        outBytes - output of processed integers
        outOff - offset to output
        intLen - block length being processed

      • des

        private void des(int[] inInts,
                 int[] outInts,
                 int[] keys)
        The DES, or the Feistel function. For further information see e.g. http://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard
        Parameters:
        inInts - input
        outInts - output
        keys - sub-keys
